vo-dml:model.name: ProvDM
vo-dml:model.description: This is the data model for the provenance of observations. It contains the IVOA UML Profile and imports the IVOA_Profile data model with primitive types.
vo-dml:model.title: Provenance Data Model
vo-dml:model.author: Kristin Riebe
Florian Rothmaier
Markus Demleitner
Gerard Lemson
Mireille Louys
Adrian Partl

objectType.name: Activity
objectType.description: An Activity is any kind of link between input and result data. It is a process that acts upon an entity (data), usually with the goal of changing that entity. Here, it is usually an observation or postprocessing of images.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: A unique id for the Activity so that it can be referred to.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: String for naming an Activity. There could be multiple alternative names.

attribute.name: executionDate
attribute.description: Date/time when the Activity was executed (start time)

attribute.name: executionDuration
attribute.description: Can provide the duration of the execution, i.e. could also contain exposure time for observation (or is this characterisation??) or how long the pipeline needed to process the image/data set.

attribute.name: executionState
attribute.description: String that specifies the execution state of an activity. Values for that string could be something like PROCESSING, COMPLETED, etc. Default could be COMPLETED.

collection.name: inputDataList
collection.description: The collection of input data used to perform an activity. The set of input data usually originates from a previous activity.

collection.name: resultDataList
collection.description: Ouput data as produced by an activity. The multiplicity for this activity is set to one to many data components (or data sets).

reference.name: method
reference.description: An instance of the Method class which describes how an activity is executed. For one activity there is exactly one description, i.e. the multiplicity is set to 1.

reference.name: agent
reference.description: The collection of contacts for an activity. Though is not required to specify a contact, this is a very useful piece of information. Zero-to-many instances are allowed.

reference.name: project
reference.description: A link to the project that is responsible for the Activity. Would be good to have at least one project per Activity, but we won't enforce this.

objectType.name: Method
objectType.description: The Method describes how an Activity is performed. This could be, for instance, the name of the code of a processing pipeline.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Unique id for the Method for referencing.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: String to specify the name of a method (e.g. "Flatfielding", "Creating the master bias", name of the code for a pipeline or post-processing)

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Free text to shortly describe the method used. (Like 'Protocol' in SimDM.)

collection.name: inputDataDescription
collection.description: A set of type specifications for the zero-to-many input data components.

collection.name: resultDataDescription
collection.description: A specification of the output data component(s),

objectType.name: Processing
objectType.description: Processing inherits from Activity. All processing steps like flat-fielding or astrometric calibration are covered by this class.

attribute.name: operatingSystem
attribute.description: Details about the operating system on which the processing was executed.

reference.name: processingMethod
reference.description: An instance of the Processor class used to describe the processing pipeline.

objectType.name: ProcessingMethod
objectType.description: Processor which inherits from Method describes all activities that belong to the Processing sub-class. General description for e.g. flatfielding, astrometric calibration, imageStacking etc.

attribute.name: author
attribute.description: Author of the code/processing algorithm/,,, used

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Version of the processor (code, algorithm, ...), if applicable. Not mandatory.

objectType.name: Observation
objectType.description: Observation inherits from Activity covering all cases in which the result data have been acquired by an (astronomical) observation.

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: The target of an observation, e.g. M31, Star xxx, ...

reference.name: observationMethod
reference.description: An instance of an ObservationMethod class used to describe how the observation has been done.

objectType.name: ObservationMethod
objectType.description: ObservationMethod which inherits from Method describes all activities that are considered observations.

objectType.name: Agent
objectType.description: This class defines a contact for a certain activity. Typically this is the person that has performed the activity (allow also institutions??). Details like address etc. could be useful, but at least the current affiliation should be given, so that it's possible to credit the right person/institution for certain tasks or products and to find someone when questions arise. People change affiliations, but it is likely that someone from the old affiliation knows where a person was going to or who else is in charge now.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of a person, can also be omitted, if an affiliation or project is given instead.

attribute.name: affiliation
attribute.description: A string giving the affiliation of the contact for a certain activity.

attribute.name: role
attribute.description: role of the contact, e.g. owner, publisher, ...

objectType.name: DataComponent
objectType.description: This class is the central component of our composite design pattern. This concept aims at treating the two major groups of data, files and parameter values on the one hand, and complete data set on the other hand, in the same way. The DataComponent class includes the basic properties and functionality (i.e. mainly the interface) for both groups of data.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: An id for the data component, could be a DAL-identififier or so.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name for a DataComponent. Multiple alternative names are also allowed.

attribute.name: creationDate
attribute.description: Date/time when the data component (individual data element or the complete set) was created.

attribute.name: validity
attribute.description: The validity gives an expiration date (or a timespan?) to indicate the time range in which the data (values) are valid. This is mainly important for ambient conditions (seeing, moon light, etc.) and instrument characteristics, since these are functions of time.

reference.name: parentDataSet
reference.description: Link to the data set to which a component belongs.

reference.name: dataDescription
reference.description: An instance of the DataDescription class that describes the form/structure of a data item.
TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: DataSet
objectType.description: This class covers data sets like RAVE-DR4 with its databases and database tables.

reference.name: dataComponent
reference.description: If pieces of data have the same origin, i.e. were produced by the same activity, they can be grouped to a data set. We decided to leave it to the person/tool recording provenance to decide how detailed a data set shall be separated into individual items.

objectType.name: Storage
objectType.description: Storage specifies where the (original) data produced by an activity can be found. This is not part of the Provenance Data Model (therefore the different coloring).

attribute.name: referenceURI
attribute.description: A reference to a file path, URL resource, .... where a description of the DataComponent (or the DataComponent itself??) can be found. Is this covered already by "Storage"?

objectType.name: DataDescription
objectType.description: This class describes the form/structure of a data item.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: Unique id for the DataDescription.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: A free text describing the data format.

reference.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: TransientData
objectType.description: Data components which are not data sets are either represented as parameters or structured data. The Parameter sub-class of DataComponent contains a set of key-value pairs, for instance from a configuration or a log file.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of a parameter

attribute.name: numericValue
attribute.description: The value of a Parameter instance of type real.

attribute.name: stringValue
attribute.description: The value of a Parameter instance of string type.

reference.name: transientDataDescription
reference.description: The data type underlying a parameter.

objectType.name: StoredData
objectType.description: StoredData are stored somewhere on disk, e.g. as a file or a database table. This is the "usual" type of data.

reference.name: storedDataDescription
reference.description: The format in which an instance of the StructuredData class is present.

reference.name: storage
reference.description: An instance of the Storage class which tells where to locate a certain data component.

objectType.name: TransientDataDescription
objectType.description: Describes the type of transient data, e.g. by using ucds.

attribute.name: ucd
attribute.description: A string giving the data type as a ucd.

objectType.name: StoredDataDescription
objectType.description: Describes the type/structure of stored data, e.g. a description of the file format (fits), the parameters of an input file or the table columns in the database.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: A string giving the format of a structured data element (e.g. description of the file format (fits, ascii, ...) or description of a database table)

objectType.name: Quality
objectType.description: A class for describing the quality of an Activity or DataComponent. The Quality object could just contain a list of possible keywords.

objectType.name: TemporaryData
objectType.description: This class can be used to specify data that existed only for a certain time and was deleted already, but is still usefull to describe the provenance of an activity/another data set. E.g. a telescope pipeline may produce images in between after each processing step, but only the final image is stored permanently.

reference.name: temporaryDataDescription
reference.description: Link to the description of the temporary data

objectType.name: TemporaryDataDescription
objectType.description: Describes the type/structure of temporary data.

objectType.name: DataSetDescription
objectType.description: Description of a data set as a whole, contains references to descriptions of the individual parts.

reference.name: dataDescription
reference.description: Link to the description of the components of a DataSet.

objectType.name: Project
objectType.description: This is the project responsible for executing an Activity (e.g. the RAVE collaboration). There could also be more than one project involved in an Activity.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description: A unique id of the project for referencing it from different Activities.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name(s) of the project. Alternative names can also be given.

reference.name: projectLeader
reference.description: A string to specify the person in charge of the project which has performed a certain activity.

objectType.name: InputData
objectType.description: This class serves to specify the role that a DataComponent takes when used as input for an Activity.

container.name: CONTAINER
container.description: Reference to container in collection inputDataList

reference.name: role
reference.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.
TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: ResultData
objectType.description: This class serves to specify the role that a DataComponent takes when produced as result by an Activity.

container.name: CONTAINER
container.description: Reference to container in collection resultDataList

reference.name: createdFromActivity
reference.description: Link from the result data to the activity by which it has been produced.
TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.
TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: InputDataDescription
objectType.description: This class describes the different roles of input data required for a certain method, e.g. parameter, parameter file, fits-image, etc. in a format specific for just this method.

container.name: CONTAINER
container.description: Reference to container in collection inputDataDescription

reference.description: TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.

objectType.name: ResultDataDescription
objectType.description: This class describes the different roles of result data typical for a certain method, e.g. fits-image, binary files etc. in a format specific for just this method.

container.name: CONTAINER
container.description: Reference to container in collection resultDataDescription

reference.name: createdFromMethod
reference.description: A DataDescription contains a link to the Method that describes the Activity that generated the data.
TODO : Missing description : please, update your UML model asap.
